title: Scarce Deadball Era Postcards for sale - final reduction
author: T206Jim

posts.post_title: Scarce Deadball Era Postcards for sale - final reduction
posts.post_content:
Here are several extremely scarce baseball postcards for sale:

1906 New York Highlander foldout schedule postcard. It is unused and is in nice shape with the panels attached.

Depicted are images of HOFers Keeler, Chesbro and Griffith.  Also depicted is an early image of Hal Chase in his second year in the Majors.
SOLD! shipped and insured, regular Paypal is fine.

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=273733&d=1495287295[/IMG]
[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=273734&d=1495287309[/IMG]
[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=273735&d=1495287323[/IMG]


1906 New York Giants foldout schedule postcard. It is unused and is in nice shape with the panels attached.

Depicted are images of HOFers Mathewson, McGinnity, Bresnahan and McGraw.  
No longer available, shipped and insured, regular Paypal is fine.

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=274212&d=1495675213[/IMG][IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=274213&d=1495675225[/IMG]
[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=274214&d=1495675239[/IMG]

1910 Berger Postal Oversized Card Folder of the New York Giants (6.5 inches by 5.25 inches).  It is in nice shape with the panels attached.  It has images of HOFers Mathewson, Marquard and McGraw.  No longer available, shipped and insured, regular Paypal is fine.

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=273740&d=1495287685[/IMG]
[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=273745&d=1495287849[/IMG]  [IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=273739&d=1495287661[/IMG] [IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=273741&d=1495287703[/IMG]  [IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=273742&d=1495287721[/IMG]




Early Polo Grounds postcards.  The more common colorized version is postmarked 1913.  The scarce sepia photo version is postmarked 1927, but obviously given the similarities was based on a 1912-1913 photo and could have been produced anywhere from 1912 to 1927.  

$75 shipped and insured, regular Paypal is fine.

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=273744&d=1495287813[/IMG]   [IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=273743&d=1495287787[/IMG]
1906 Giants foldout postcard added and price drop on others.
